title: Nintendo are hiring for what looks like a new 3D Mario and a 2D game
text:
Super Mario Odyssey – has work already begun on a new one?

A follow-up to Super Mario Odyssey may already be underway at Nintendo as they also post a job ad for what looks like a new 2D Mario.

Generally speaking, you only usually get one or two Super Mario games per console, but add in spin-offs, remasters, and all the rest and it all starts to get a bit hazy as to what constitutes a new game and what doesn’t.

But this Christmas, unless you count Sega’s Mario & Sonic At The Olympic Games Tokyo 2020, there definitely isn’t any new Mario game and none has been announced for next year either.

That doesn’t necessarily mean there isn’t going to be one though and given the two job ads Nintendo has just put up on its Japanese Twitter account it sounds like work is already underway on at least two.

The job ads don’t mention any specific games, but one is for a 3D title being made in Tokyo and the only in-house studio they have there works almost exclusively on 3D Mario games such as Super Mario 3D World and Super Mario Odyssey.

That’s absolutely no guarantee that what the job is for is Mario-related but at some point, given its huge success, there’s got to be a follow-up to Odyssey and the odds are this is the first indication that work has already begun.

The 2D ad is in a similar situation – in that technically it could be any franchise – but the tweet for it is plastered in imagery from 2D Mario games and really does give the impression that that’s the sort of thing the job applicant would be working on.

None of the Japanese text gives anything way so at the end of the day it’s all speculation, but at the very least we know that one of Nintendo’s most acclaimed studios is working on a new 3D game and that a new 2D title, of some sort, is also underway.
